tn.text: God had decided that the land of Canaan would belong to the people of Israel, but they had not yet moved into it. AT: "which I have decided to give" or "which I will soon give" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pastforfuture]])

tn.ref: Each man must be a leader among them
tn.text: "Each man whom you send must be a leader among his tribe"
These are men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Shaphat ... Hori ... Jephunneh ... Igal ... Joseph ... Nun
tn.text: These are all men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Palti ... Raphu ... Gaddiel ... Sodi ... Gaddi ... Susi ... Ammiel ... Gemalli
tn.text: These are all men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: from the tribe of Joseph (that is to say, from the tribe Manasseh)
tn.text: The relationship between between Joseph and Manasseh can be stated clearly. AT:  "from the tribe of Joseph's son Manasseh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Sethur ... Michael ... Nahbi ... Vophsi ... Geuel ... Machi
tn.text: These are all men's names. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translate these men's names as you did in [[:en:bible:notes:num:13:05|13:8]].

tn.ref: Is it good or bad? What cities are there? Are they like camps, or are they fortified cities?
tn.text: Moses asks these questions to explain the kind of information that the men were to report back to him. These can be expressed as a statement. AT: "See if the land is good or bad, what kind of cities are there, and whether those cities are only camps, or whether they have defensive walls around them." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: Are they like camps, or are they fortified cities
tn.text: Fortified cities had strong walls around them to protect them from enemy armies. Camps did not have these walls.
These are names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
The word "Sin" here is the Hebrew name of the wilderness. It is not the English word "sin." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_transliterate]])

tn.ref: Hebron had been built seven years before Zoan in Egypt
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "the Canaanites had built Hebron 7 years before the Egyptians built Zoan" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
These are names of clans that were named after their ancestors. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"between two men of their group"
This can be stated in active form. AT: "They named that place" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"After 40 days" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Here "word" refers to a report. AT: "They brought back their report" or "They reported what they had seen" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: It certainly flows with milk and honey
tn.text: "Milk and honey certainly flow there." They spoke of the land being good for animals and plants as if the milk and honey from those animals and plants were flowing through the land. AT: "It is certainly excellent for raising livestock and growing crops" or "It is certainly very fertile land"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Since milk comes from cows and goats, it represents livestock and the food produced from the the livestock. AT: "food from livestock" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Since honey is produced from flowers, it represents crops and the food produced from the crops. AT: "food from crops" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
Here "they" refers to all of the men who examined the land except for Caleb and Joshua.

tn.ref: the land that they had examined
tn.text: Here "they" refers to all of the men who examined the land including Caleb and Joshua.

tn.ref: a land that eats up its inhabitants
tn.text: The men speak of the land, or the people of the land, being very dangerous as if the land ate up people. AT: "a very dangerous land" or "a land where the people will kill us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: In our own sight ... in their sight
tn.text: Here sight represents opinion. AT: "In our own opinion ... in their opinion" [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: we were like grasshoppers in comparison with them
tn.text: The men speak of grasshoppers to show how very small they thought themselves to be compared to the people of the land. AT: "we are as small as grasshoppers in comparison with them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
